qas.question: What kind of climate does Punjab have?

answers.text: rice, sugarcane, millet, corn, oilseeds, pulses, vegetables, and fruits such as kinoo

qas.question: What aspects of Punjab's climate make it perfect for agriculture?

context: Despite <b9_0>its <a0_0>tropical wet and dry<a0_0/> climate<b9_0/>, extensive irrigation makes it a rich agricultural region. Its canal-irrigation system established by <a1_0><b6_0>the British<b6_0/><a1_0/> is the largest in the world. <a2_0><b7_0>Wheat and cotton<b7_0/><a2_0/> are the largest crops. Other crops include <a3_0>rice, sugarcane, millet, corn, oilseeds, pulses, vegetables, and fruits such as <b8_0>kinoo<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Livestock and poultry production are also important. Despite past animosities, the rural masses in Punjab's farms continue to use <a4_0>the <b5_0>Hindu<b5_0/> calendar<a4_0/> for planting and harvesting.
